questions.question: What is the main purpose of React?
questions.explanation: React is a JavaScript library used for building fast and interactive UIs.

questions.question: Which hook is used to manage state in a functional component?
questions.explanation: useState lets you add component state to functional components.

questions.question: What does JSX stand for?
questions.explanation: JSX stands for JavaScript XML â€” it allows writing HTML in React.

questions.question: Which hook runs after every render by default?
questions.explanation: useEffect runs after each render unless dependency array is provided.

questions.question: Props in React are:
options: Used to store local component data
questions.explanation: Props are read-only data passed from parent to child.

questions.question: What is the correct way to pass a prop?
questions.explanation: JSX uses HTML-like syntax; props are passed like HTML attributes.

questions.question: Which hook is used for performance optimization?
questions.explanation: useMemo memoizes expensive calculations to improve performance.

questions.question: Which method is used to update state in class components?
questions.explanation: Class components use setState() to update the state.

questions.question: React uses which type of DOM?
questions.explanation: React improves performance using Virtual DOM.

questions.question: What is lifting state up?
options: Moving state from parent to child
Moving state from child to parent
questions.explanation: Lifting state up means sharing data by moving state to a common parent.
